Life Event: Warren James Bland was born in Culver City, California.
Father dies of heart attack.
Marries Sue Ellen Sweeney, raped her on their wedding night then continuously for their marriage 2 months 10 days.
Sue Ellen files for annulment citing grounds of extreme cruelty and grievous mental suffering.

Bland enlisted for a three-year stint in the Marine Corps, immediately shipped to San Diego for basic training. Five weeks later went AWOL, found one month later, sent to the brig for 6 months of hard labor, brought back for basic training.
AWOL second time, classified a deserter.
Arrested, court-martialed, sentenced to another 6 months of hard labor, discharged for bad conduct from the Marine Corps.
Released from U.S. Marines.
Suspect in murder case of an officer on duty, never charged with crime.
Arrested for taking a 1956 Thunderbird for a test drive and keeping it.
Pleaded guilty to grand theft auto, sentenced to 30 days in county jail and 3 years probation.
Took Dorothy Cobb to Las Vegas and married her, after raping her a few months earlier.

Found guilty of assault with a deadly weapon but lessened to assault with force likely to produce great bodily injury after slicing a man in the abdomen with a bayonet for trying to talk to his wife, Dorothy, who was 7 months pregnant at the time.
$250 fine, pay medical expenses, 5 years probation for the stabbing.
Bland’s daughter, Debbie Ann Bland born.
Dorothy left Bland, fleeing to Alaska for 6 months to live with cousin, returned to file for divorce when read in the papers Bland had been arrested for rape.
Raped a woman.
Raped a 46-year old secretary.
Raped a 40-year old woman.
Charged with forcible rape, robbery, kidnapping, kidnapping for the purpose of robbery, 3 counts of attempted rape.
Pleaded not guilty by reason of insanity and denied any prior offense. Evaluated by several psychologists who received very different accounts of the crimes from Bland
Committed to Atascadero State Hospital for 90 day observation period, in June determined to commit Bland to the hospital for an indeterminate period.
Head of hospital recommends that Bland be sent back through the criminal justice system because he was not benefiting from treatment at the hospital.
Bland released, put on 5 years probation.
Bland behind bars again, after two women were raped, two had fought off attacker, and 15 year old girl left for dead after her throat was slit. Attacks were from August to November.

Sentenced 3 years to life for one rape count, 1 to 25 years on kidnapping charge, and 5 years to life for burglary counts, all sentences to run concurrently. Officially a first timer in the penal system.
Bland paroled. One year later, almost to the day, Bland arrested again for assaultive sexual conduct. For the first time ever his victim was a young girl.
Released from prison again after incarcerated for above crime.
Attacked, tortured, and raped an 11 year old boy.
Arrested for suspected child molestation, released on $35,000 bail.

Plead guilty to 2 counts of child molestation with the use of a deadly weapon and admitted to prior convictions. Sentenced to 9 years in prison and sent to the California Men’s Institution in Chino, east of Los Angeles. When speaking with prison psychologists, admitted for the first time of being a lifelong drinker.
During time between prison terms, moved in with a woman and her three daughters, which he molested.
Norma Williams (woman he lived with) felt she could turn him around with Christianity and married Bland.
Bland attacked in prison by fellow inmate, neck split open from ear to collarbone, almost bled to death.
Bland paroled again.
Phoebe Ho (AF, 7) is abducted in South Pasadena, CA.
Phoebe Ho’s body found in Riverside County, CA.
Search warrant obtained to search Bland’s house. Forensic matches for a fiber from Bland’s car and a hair found in search
Bland goes on the run, changes name to James Thaddeus Sterling and Charles St. Germain.
Body of Wendy Osborn (WF, 14) found in San Bernardino County. Bland suspected of her murder, never charged.
Charges filed for the murder of Phoebe Ho.
Bland found in Pacific Beach, CA. Tried to flee cops, was shot and almost died when captured.
Also suspected, but never charged, with the murder of Ruth Ost (WF, 81) in San Diego.
Trial finally set for murder of Phoebe Ho.
Bland found guilty and sentenced to death.
Died in prison from natural causes.
